jobDescription: POSITION SUMMARY  This San Francisco based Global Account Manager will work closely with client contacts and internal Global Team members to ensure client procedures and international immigration regulations are met. It is common for a position of this seniority to manage a large client volume with matters located across all regions as well as supervise more junior members of the Global Team. RESPONSIBILITIES · Oversee client matters across the Americas, EMEA, and/or AsiaPacific regions via internal regional teams and global network partners  · Serve as the main point of contact for international clients and third-party vendors  · Provide clients with country-specific advice, case strategy and visa assessments  · Review all emails and data on specific client accounts to ensure adherence to client protocols and Service Level Agreements (SLAs)  · Create or update client-specific protocols, procedures, and policies and provide training as necessary  · Assist in resolving client issues related to work performance and service levels  · Contribute towards the training and development of Global Team members on various global immigration issues and country procedures as needed  · Ensure client and internal billing procedures are followed accurately in addition to reviewing client invoices  · Streamline regional processes in line with internal and client-specific requirements  · Monitor immigration trends and issues in key destination countries and update impacted clients as needed SKILLS · Proven ability to communicate with all levels of a client’s organization  · Professional and efficient management and resolution of client concerns or escalations  · Strong time management, multi-tasking and interpersonal skills  · Solid analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to formulate and communicate recommendations for improvement  · Proven experience managing team members while ensuring client cases, procedures and billing needs are fully metEXPERIENCE· 5+ years handling a wide variety of immigration matters  · Minimum of 2-3 years in global client account management EDUCATION · Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience
